name: The Lord of the Ring
title: This trilogy by J.R.R. Tolkien was incredibly popular when it was first published over 60 years ago.

name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
title: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the famous detective, Sherlock Holmes.

name: Pride and Prejudice
title: A classic novel by Jane Austen that explores the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

name: Moby Dick
title: Herman Melville’s classic about the obsessive quest of Ahab, captain of the whaler the Pequod, to take revenge on Moby Dick.
George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance, censorship, and thought control.

name: The Great Gatsby
title: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel of the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American dream.

name: Frankenstein
title: Mary Shelley's Gothic novel that explores the consequences of playing god and creating life.

name: Dracula
title: Bram Stoker's vampire novel that introduced Count Dracula and established many conventions of subsequent vampire fantasy.

name: War and Peace
title: Leo Tolstoy's historical novel set during the Napoleonic wars in Russia.

name: The Odyssey
title: Homer's epic poem recounting the adventures of Odysseus as he struggles to return home from the Trojan War.

name: Jane Eyre
title: Charlotte Brontë's novel about an orphaned girl’s journey to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.
